entry.title: Support Vector Machines
entry.content:
I heard SVM many times before, and got to see what it is now. ðŸ˜„

1.2.1 Gaussian Kernel

1.2.3 Example Dataset 3

I wrote the Gaussian Kernel function in a way that it can be pass sigma as a vector and get a sim vector, therefore g = gaussianKernel(x1, x2, s) is a vector and can skip for s = l which is a redundant compute in for c = l loop. Then if the svmTrain can be computer as a vector, the for c = l can also be skip.

But it canâ€™t. ðŸ˜¢

Is it has any connections with the functional programming?

2.1.1 Vocabulary List

2.2 Extracting Features from Emails

entry.title: Neural Networks Representation
entry.content:
Neural Networks Representation

1.3 Vectorizing Logistic Regression

Alright, I already used the Vectorized approach and without any loops last exercise.

1.4 One-vs-all Classification

the key points here are:

  • for is needed here to loop from 1 to num_labels
  • all_theta should assigned with (i,:), otherwise it will be a one-dimensional vector.

1.4.1 One-vs-all Prediction

the max function will return a two-dimensional vector, m is the value, and p is the max index in that row.

2 Neural Networks

Finally, I touched the Neural Networks with so many classes after. ðŸ˜³

The $\theta1, \theta2$ are trained to predict.

Before this, I wondering what is the process of prediction with a trained model. Is it the same with the training process?

Amazing ha! ðŸ¤©

First I forgot to sigmoid the hidden layer and output layer. The Accuracy shows

Training Set Accuracy: 69.62

And it will got the same accuracy if the output layer has no sigmoid . It also happened in the previous One-vs-all Prediction.

Therefore I still have the question. ðŸ§

Itâ€™s time to keep on the training part. ðŸ’ª

Therefore I still have the question. ðŸ§

Itâ€™s time to keep on the training part. ðŸ’ª

entry.title: Machine Learning by Stanford University
entry.content:
Machine Learning by Stanford University

It is a note about the process that Iâ€™m trying to learn Machine Learning on coursera.

I heard AI a year ago, but never really look into it as an elderly who is hardly to accept new things.

But it seems I will loss job at this generation AIðŸ¤–ï¸ revolution, therefore Iâ€™ll try my best to learn it.

Still, I am too old to learn and have no confidence to guarantee I can really master it one day.

ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚

1 Linear Regression with One Variable

2 Linear Regression with Multiple Variables

ex1

This is my favorite part, I love coding ðŸ˜„.

ComputeCost

You see, the cost function here

(OMG: the formula code is J(\theta) = \cfrac{1}{2m}\sum\limits_{i=1}^{m}(h_\theta(x^{(i)}) - y^{(i)} )^2 in markdown) ðŸ¤¯

In fact, I found it is X * theta in the real calculation by Octave instead of theta' * X as the formula shows.

GradientDescent

Similarly, the Gradient Descent here:

repeat until convergence: {

â€‹

â€‹

}

It take me hours ðŸ’¥ to figure out why should I using X' * ((X * theta) - y))

Because all the variables X, theta , y, each of them is a vector, Xâ€™ * (â€¦) equal to sum() part as the formule shows.

I am still a little bit confused although I passed the test. ðŸ˜µ

3 Logistic Regression

To Be Continuedâ€¦

entry.title: Batch replace NamedColors to RGB in Storyboard
entry.content:
NamedColors is a new feature that really convenient for developers to use in Xcode

But it is only a available on iOS 11, and it will cause app crash on iOS 10, 9â€¦

The main idea is:

  • Use NamedColors in StoryBoard to avoid fill color every time to benefit the new feature.
  • Replace all NamedColorsâ€™ attributes to RGB in StoryBoard when build the project to avoid crash on iOS old version.

First, save it as NamedColors2RGB.py in your project root folder.

Then, Xcode -> Project File -> Build Phases -> Add Build Phase -> Add Run Script

If you found anyway to reverse it back to NamedColors, please leave a msg to me.

After all, once the NamedColors changed, all the color in the interface builder should be changed too.
entry.summary:
NamedColors is a new feature that really convenient for developers to use in Xcode

But it is only a available on iOS 11, and it will cause app crash on iOS 10, 9â€¦

The main idea is:

  • Use NamedColors in StoryBoard to avoid fill color every time to benefit the new feature.
  • Replace all NamedColorsâ€™ attributes to RGB in StoryBoard when build the project to avoid crash on iOS old version.

First, save it as NamedColors2RGB.py in your project root folder.

entry.title: Building Apps for iPhone X
entry.content:
First, Watching Building Apps for iPhone X with 2x speed to get a glance, it will speed 13/2 minutes.

  • The key point is to open Safe Area in Storyboard.
  • The LayoutConstraint attracted to superview can beyond the Safe Area.

My current app has 17 Storyboards and 28 ViewControllers.

In each ViewController, the previous develepers used an UIView on top to cover the systemâ€™s navigationController to do some tricks, which means the constraint of the view has a height == 64, and top == superview.top.

Although itâ€™s a little disgusting, but it works on previous devices which navigationbarâ€™s height are always 64.

But on iPhone X, it need to use Safe Area. Which means I have better to delete the fake navigationView. But that means move all the buttons, actions, animations to the systemâ€™s navigationController if the segue kind is push.

Honestly to say, itâ€™s much easier than I thought after all works done.

For the segue kind is present modally, the fake view still do its job by changed itâ€™s height only if the device is iPhone X.

Other usefull tools
entry.summary:
First, Watching Building Apps for iPhone X with 2x speed to get a glance, it will speed 13/2 minutes.

  • The key point is to open Safe Area in Storyboard.
  • The LayoutConstraint attracted to superview can beyond the Safe Area.

entry.title: 22 Generate Parentheses
entry.content:
22 Generate Parentheses

Tips:

  • If there is a ( on the left, it should have a ) somewhere on the right
  • N will have one more () comparing with N-1

Therefore, Iterate all items in N-1 array, for each Parentheses String,

  • Left â†’ Right, if the char is (, insert a () behind
  • Add () in the Leftmost

Put these two new strings into a Set collection to eliminate redundancy.

å¯¹äºŽ N-1 çš„é›†åˆé‡Œçš„æ¯ä¸ª String,

  • éåŽ†ï¼Œä»Žå·¦å¾€å³ï¼Œç¢°åˆ°å·¦æ‹¬å·ï¼Œæ’å…¥()
  • æœ€å·¦è¾¹è¡¥ ()

æ”¾åˆ° Set é‡ŒåŽ»é‡
entry.summary:
22 Generate Parentheses

Tips:

  • If there is a ( on the left, it should have a ) somewhere on the right
  • N will have one more () comparing with N-1

Therefore, Iterate all items in N-1 array, for each Parentheses String,

  • Left â†’ Right, if the char is (, insert a () behind
  • Add () in the Leftmost

Put these two new strings into a Set collection to eliminate redundancy.

entry.content:
19 Remove Nth Node From End of List

Traverse all the Note and put their reference into a [ListNode] , once you can get their sequence number.

Be careful that list.count == n which means you have to delete the head

å¦å¤–è¦æ³¨æ„ä¸‹ n æ˜¯ head æ—¶ï¼Œä¸Šä¸€ä¸ª note æ˜¯ nil
entry.summary:
19 Remove Nth Node From End of List

Tips:

Traverse all the Note and put their reference into a [ListNode] , once you can get their sequence number.

Be careful that list.count == n which means you have to delete the head

entry.title: 17 Letter Combinations of a Phone Number
entry.content:
17 Letter Combinations of a Phone Number

Tips:

The final data structure is a tree, if it generated and stored as a tree, the memory size would be cost to much.

The point is using each new character in the string to Multiply the [String] which was generated in the previous step.

ç»“æžœæ˜¯ä¸€é¢—æ ‘ï¼Œå¦‚æžœä¸€æ¬¡æž„å»ºï¼Œå†éåŽ†ï¼Œç»“æž„ä¼šå¾ˆå¤æ‚å¹¶ä¸”å ç©ºé—´

åˆ†è€Œæ²»ä¹‹å°±å¥½åŠžäº†ï¼ˆä¸¤ä¸ªå‡½æ•°ï¼‰
entry.summary:
17 Letter Combinations of a Phone Number

Tips:

The final data structure is a tree, if it generated and stored as a tree, the memory size would be cost to much.

The point is using each new character in the string to Multiply the [String] which was generated in the previous step.

entry.title: How to trust MitM Certificate on iPhoneÂ Simulator
entry.content:
How to trust MitM Certificate on iPhone Simulator

Open Keychain and export the MitM Root certificate as .cer ( not .p12 ), drag it to the simulator, then go to Settings.General.About.CertificateTrustSettings.ENABLE FULL TRUST FOR ROOT CERTIFICATES, open the Switch which is your MitM.

Before that, I dragged .p12, and it can trusted in Settings.General.Profiles, but canâ€™t be see in Settings.General.About.Certificate Trust Settings.

This wasted lots of time, and I found something like: Modify TrustStore.sqlite3

That is terrible. There it no need to say the TrustStore.sqlite3 no longer in at that path.

After read Installing a CAâ€™s Root Certificate on Your Test Device and found nothing.

Iâ€™m glad tried .cer several days later, now I can watch all requests on specific domains by Surge.
entry.summary:
How to trust MitM Certificate on iPhone Simulator

Open Keychain and export the MitM Root certificate as .cer ( not .p12 ), drag it to the simulator, then go to Settings.General.About.CertificateTrustSettings.ENABLE FULL TRUST FOR ROOT CERTIFICATES, open the Switch which is your MitM.
